intro: Cacalia scorpioides, commonly known as the scorpionweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive, spiky appearance that resembles a scorpion, giving it its common name. Cacalia scorpioides is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions and salt spray.
